DataElement.preferredDefinition: A floating point decimal number measured in kilovolts to capture the peak accelerating voltage applied in an X-ray tube between the cathode and anode.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic._The peak accelerating voltage applied in an X-ray tube between the cathode and anode.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Concepts.definition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Property.preferredDefinition: The peak accelerating voltage applied in an X-ray tube between the cathode and anode.

Concepts.definition: The peak accelerating voltage applied in an X-ray tube between the cathode and anode.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 5/16/17 jk Changed Context, WF/registration status to released and added to NCI Standards CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 10/22/08 - released post NCIA Interim Rpt Changes

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: DS kV: A floating point decimal number measured in kilovolts.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number that can have its decimal point in any position.:A prefix indicating a quantity of one thousand, 10E3.:The SI derived unit of electric potential and electromotive force, equal to the difference of electric potential between two points on a conducting wire carrying a constant current of one ampere when the power dissipated between the points is one watt, equivalent to the potential difference across a resistance of one ohm when one ampere of current flows through it.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A number that can have its decimal point in any position.
A prefix indicating a quantity of one thousand, 10E3.

A SI derived unit of electric potential and electromotive force, equal to the difference of electric potential between two points on a conducting wire carrying a constant current of one ampere when the power dissipated between the points is one watt, equivalent to the potential difference across a resistance of one ohm when one ampere of current flows through it.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 1/15/10 added float as qualifer per content administrator's review.  6/23/09 created for UOM Specific VD for DICOM FD Value Representation type to load NCIA v4.4 model.

DataElement.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
